our_story.title: Our Story
story: In 2019, during a trip through New Zealand, Alex was working in the vineyards where he met a friendly German — spoiler: Madeline’s brother. The two quickly hit it off, and the invitation was casually extended: if Alex ever found himself in Germany, he should stop by. On his way back to Canada, Alex made a spontaneous detour to Europe to visit his new friend in Germany and another buddy in the Netherlands.

During his stay with the family in Germany, Alex met Madeline – and it quickly became clear that there was something special between them. After he left, they stayed in touch, constantly exchanging voice messages while Alex worked as a ground crew member for a crop-dusting company in Saskatchewan. The early mornings gave them more time to talk before the time difference pulled them apart each day.

As their connection deepened, Alex booked a return trip to Germany — this time just to see Madeline. They spent three unforgettable weeks road-tripping through Austria and passed the ultimate relationship test: traveling together nonstop. Not only were they not annoyed with each other, but by the end of the trip, they decided to really try a long-distance relationship (even though Alex initially said, “Let’s not label it” — classic move).

After another difficult goodbye, Alex returned to Canada and jumped back into oil drilling work to save up quickly. Then Madeline made a bold move — she visited him in February — in Saskatchewan — where temperatures regularly drop below -40°C. She stayed with him through the freezing cold and long days on the oil rig, just happy to be together. That’s when Alex knew she truly meant it.

Her return flight was canceled due to COVID, and although part of Alex hoped she would stay longer, they both knew she had to go back. That time together solidified their plans: Alex would move to Germany, and they would build a life together. That was in 2020, and they’ve never looked back — despite the challenges of adjusting to a new country, culture, and language.
After all the years of distance, hard goodbyes, and heartfelt reunions, Alex and Madeline are overjoyed to finally say 'I do' and begin the next chapter — together, forever.
our_story.quote: True love is like wildflowers... it’s often found in the most unlikely places.

reception.title: Reception
reception.description: Join us for dinner, dancing, and celebration in a tent near the ceremony site. The surrounding area will be open for guests to enjoy outdoor games and socializing. Cocktail hour will begin immediately after the ceremony. More information about the venue can be found at

paulushaus.description: Group house, ideal for larger self-catering groups. Kitchen, outdoor area with sports/playground, basic amenities. No restaurant. ~0 km to the venue; ~4 km to the city center. Free parking.
paulushaus.info: The venue is 4 km outside the city, so transportation is needed to get there and back. Taxis are available if you don’t rent a car. There’s also a nearby bus stop within walking distance if you prefer public transport.

hotelRemspark.description: Modern 4-star hotel near the city center. Fitness area, rooftop restaurant/bar, breakfast buffet. ~7–8 km to the venue. Paid parking on-site. Bike rental available for a fee, and Wi-Fi included.

hotelSchwaebischGmuend.description: Comfortable 4-star hotel with wellness area (pool, sauna, fitness), breakfast buffet, and regional cuisine. ~6–7 km to the venue. Underground parking (~€10/day). Located right at the train station.

schoenblick.description: Quiet guesthouse near the forest. Breakfast included, basic amenities, park area, and free parking. ~1–2 km to the venue; ~2.5 km to the city center.

mutlangerHof.description: Simple and quiet guesthouse in Mutlangen. Free Wi-Fi, continental breakfast, and bike rental. ~5 km to the venue; ~3.5 km to the city center. Free parking on-site.

transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.description: The closest major cities with international airports to the venue are Stuttgart, Frankfurt, and Munich. Stuttgart Airport (STR) is closer and more convenient, but Frankfurt (FRA) and Munich (MUC) also offer good options with more international connections.
transportation.notice1: From each of these airports, you have three main options to reach the area:

train.title: Train
train.description: All three airports have train connections to Schwäbisch Gmünd, the closest city to the venue. Depending on your route, a transfer may be required, typically in Stuttgart or Göppingen.

carRental.title: Car Rental
carRental.description: Renting a car is a convenient option and provides flexibility, especially if you’re staying in the countryside or want to explore the region. Highways connect all three airports to Schwäbisch Gmünd (about 45 minutes from Stuttgart, 2.5 hours from Frankfurt or Munich).

venueDetails.description: Once you arrive in Schwäbisch Gmünd, the venue is located in a nearby rural area about 4 km outside the city.
venueDetails.notice1: From Schwäbisch Gmünd, you can reach the venue and surrounding areas in a few ways:

bus.title: Bus
bus.description: Local bus 72 stops near the venue. The stop is called Lindach, Paulushaus. *Please inform the driver where you need to get off to ensure you exit at the correct location.

taxi.title: Taxi
taxi.description: Taxis are available at the train station and in the city. You can contact the following taxi companies:

car.title: Car
car.description: If you’re staying outside the city or have a rental car, driving is the most flexible option. Parking is available at the venue and most accommodations.

venueDetails.planningReminder: Please plan accordingly based on which airport you arrive at and whether you will use public transportation or rent a car. We’re happy to help coordinate if you're unsure!
